comments.body: Just a question: why don't we remove these deprecated labels? I guess they are for the legacy issues and PRs which already have had such labels.

I'd like to see them gone too, but wanted to keep this PR trivial.  I defer to @kubernetes/sig-contributor-experience-misc for modification of labels since I don't have write privs here.  Unclear to me whether removing, renaming, or swapping labels would alter github issue recency.

yeah, removing these labels might cause problem to issues with such labels. It'd be better to replace them with alternative labels for those issues automatically. @fejta is there any way doing this?
TBH, I don't like deprecated things, they always make me confused: why are they deprecated? when will they be removed? what's the alternative? etc.
`labeler` can rename labels, and I'm sure prow or mungegithub could help here, just unsure whether it'd modify recency (or if we care)

What are the alternatives?

I agree with Aaron that figuring out how to retire labels seems outside the scope of this PR...

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +331,335 @@- name: team/test-infra
  color: ededed
- name: team/ux (deprecated - do not use)
  color: ededed
- name: triaged
